intro: Cynoglossum nebrodense subsp. nebrodense, commonly known as the Nebrodian forget-me-not, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. The plant features basal leaves that are lanceolate and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are blue to violet, arranged in loose clusters. It is part of the Boraginaceae family, known for its medicinal and ornamental uses. The subspecies is distinguished by its specific habitat and floral characteristics, making it a notable species in alpine and subalpine environments.
